quest.name: Church Warrant
journal:
 Quest Sync
Tofrith wishes to share the tale of a passing traveler.
objectives: Slay the cursed weapon and retrieve the traveling historian's pack.
Return the pack to the traveling historian.

dialogue.name: TOFRITH
dialogue.text: Another traveler are you? Place is crawlin' with 'em, it seems. Just had one askin' me about local ruins, so I pointed him in the direction of Kelk.

dialogue.name: TOFRITH
dialogue.text: I tried to tell him about all the evil weapons skulkin' around the place, but I think my words of warnin' went in one ear and out the other.

dialogue.name: TOFRITH
dialogue.text: I've half a mind to go in there after and drag him out of harm's way. Trouble is, I'm not much of a fighter, so I'd only end up gettin' meself killed.

dialogue.name: TOFRITH
dialogue.text: You, on the other hand, might stand a chance. Will you go and see if you can find the daft bugger?

dialogue.name: TOFRITH
dialogue.text: Can't say I see the appeal in spendin' me life travelin'. Not knowin' where your next meal's comin' from, gettin' chased around by all sorts of horrible creatures. Sod that!

dialogue.name: MINER03502
dialogue.text: You are come to my rescue! A thousand blessings upon you!

dialogue.name: MINER03502
dialogue.text: Though I feel that curses are more appropriate for those evil weapons! They stole my weapon─of the standard, non-enchanted variety─my only means of defense.

dialogue.name: MINER03502
dialogue.text: That was not the only thing they took from me. They have my pack, with all of my supplies and apparatus inside! Would you be able to help me reclaim it?

dialogue.name: MINER03502
dialogue.text: They carried it up those stairs and into the deeper reaches of the ruins. Do be quick, lest they devour my field notes!

dialogue.name: MINER03502
dialogue.text: Oh! I do hope the contents have not incurred any damage!

dialogue.name: MINER03502
dialogue.text: Praise be! My instruments and such are largely unscathed! And most importantly, my field notes are all present and correct. I do not know what I would have done if I had lost the fruits of my research into the Church of the First Light!

dialogue.name: MINER03502
dialogue.text: I daresay the name rings a bell. Most have heard of this ancient religion, yet few know its history. If it pleases you, I may offer a relatively succinct summary of my findings.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Speak on.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Sorry. More pressing matters require my attention.

dialogue.name: MINER03502
dialogue.text: The Church of the First Light was one of the most widespread religions and had followers in every corner of Norvrandt.

dialogue.name: MINER03502
dialogue.text: It began with the original inhabitants, the elves, and eventually took root among the other races.

dialogue.name: MINER03502
dialogue.text: This included not only their allies, the Humes, but the Galdjent and Drahn, with whom they shared a tumultuous relationship.

dialogue.name: MINER03502
dialogue.text: The Church of the First Light's influence grew to such an extent that it surpassed even that of the monarchs and rulers of the various nations.

dialogue.name: MINER03502
dialogue.text: That was until the Flood of Light changed everything. The Light that they so revered was not their salvation, but their destruction.

dialogue.name: MINER03502
dialogue.text: As you may well imagine, those who survived quickly abandoned the religion, and its teachings were all but forgotten. I have made it my life's work to see that these people and their ways are not similarly lost to the sands of time.

dialogue.name: MINER03502
dialogue.text: Though I understand the perils involved with the exploration of ancient ruins, I feel we must do our utmost to retain what knowledge we can of the world that existed before the Flood.

dialogue.name: MINER03502
dialogue.text: Yes, quite. Places to go, things to slay, I expect.

dialogue.name: MINER03502
dialogue.text: Ahem. It seems that we have dallied here long enough. However, it would be remiss of me to part from you without offering my gratitude for the retrieval of my irreplaceable research materials.

dialogue.name: MINER03502
dialogue.text: I will return to Twine and give my thanks to Tofrith for suggesting that I visit these ruins. It was a most worthwhile expedition indeed. Fare thee well!

dialogue.name: TOFRITH
dialogue.text: Our mutual acquaintance, the travelin' fruitcake, came by to thank me. Not that I really did much besides sending you to help.

dialogue.name: TOFRITH
dialogue.text: Anyway, he left this for you. Show of gratitude, or summink.
